articles.description: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min says he will leave the club this summer after 10 years.
articles.title: Son Heung-min: Tottenham captain to leave this summer after 10 years at club

articles.description: India quick Prasidh Krishna admits it was a deliberate tactic to try and disrupt Joe Root after the pair were involved in a heated exchange on day two of the fifth Test at The Oval.
articles.title: England vs India: 'Part of the plan' to disrupt Joe Root, says Prasidh Krishna

articles.description: The Lions are focused on completing a clean sweep against the Wallabies in Sydney in Saturday's final Test.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: Tourists target clean sweep in final Test

articles.description: Newcastle United reject an offer from Liverpool for wantaway striker Alexander Isak.
articles.title: Alexander Isak transfer news: Newcastle United reject opening Liverpool bid for striker

articles.description: McLaren driver Lando Norris' openness in admitting his frailties is "used against him", according to his former team-mate Carlos Sainz.
articles.title: Hungarian GP: Lando Norris' openness used against him - Sainz

articles.description: As Sheffield Wednesday's crisis deepens, concern for the club's future is growing.
articles.title: Sheffield Wednesday: EFL increasingly concerned over financial crisis and fixture fulfilment

articles.description: Japan's Miyu Yamashita shoots a bogey-free 65 in her second round to lead the AIG Women's Open by three shots at Royal Porthcawl.
articles.title: Women's Open 2025: Miyu Yamashita leads by three after second-round 65 at Royal Porthcawl

articles.description: The Ineos Grenadiers staff member who is due to speak to the International Testing Agency about doping allegations relating to the 2012 season worked at Manchester United last year.
articles.title: Man Utd: Ineos Grenadiers carer facing questions about possible doping links worked at club in 2024

articles.description: The Premier League will not reduce in size from 20 clubs, says chief executive Richard Masters, amid tensions with Fifa over the congested calendar.
articles.title: Premier League will not reduce from 20 to 18 clubs - Richard Masters

articles.description: Maeva Squiban produces another stunning performance to record back-to-back stage wins and make Tour de Femmes history as Kim le Court retains the yellow jersey.
articles.title: Tour de Femmes: Maeva Squiban wins historic back-to-back stages
